title: Discarded Conversations #7
description: Hand-pulled paper made from discarded office documents, transforming forgotten corporate communications into tactile art objects that reveal hidden patterns in everyday waste.
projectDescription: An ongoing investigation into waste streams and material transformation, using traditional papermaking techniques to give new life to discarded documents and creating contemplative objects from the detritus of daily life.
medium: Handmade paper from recycled office documents

images.alt: Handmade paper sheet with visible text fragments and organic texture
images.caption: Final paper sheet showing ghostly text fragments embedded in the handmade paper surface

images.alt: Close-up of paper texture showing embedded text and fiber patterns
images.caption: Detail showing the interplay between original text and new paper matrix

images.alt: Documents being pulped in water for papermaking
images.caption: Initial stage: corporate documents being broken down in the pulping process

images.alt: Paper pulp being formed on a screen
images.caption: Forming the new paper sheet on the papermaking screen

processNotes: Each sheet takes approximately 3 days from collection to finished piece. The most interesting discoveries happen when unexpected documents create visual patterns - legal contracts become topographical maps, and email threads form organic textures.
inspiration: Fascinated by the parallel between paper recycling and memory - how information gets broken down and reformed into something entirely new, yet traces of the original remain visible.
technicalNotes: I avoid using any bleaching agents, preferring to let the original inks and toners create subtle color variations in the final sheets. Some documents resist breaking down completely, creating intentional imperfections.
